text: In that day shall this song be sung in the land of Judah: “We have a strong city; salvation will God appoint for walls and bulwarks.
speaker: Narrator

text: Open ye the gates, that the righteous nation which keepeth the truth may enter in.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou wilt keep him in perfect peace, whose mind is stayed on Thee, because he trusteth in Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Trust ye in the Lord for ever, for in the Lord Jehovah is everlasting strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: For He bringeth down them that dwell on high; the lofty city, He layeth it low; He layeth it low, even to the ground; He bringeth it even to the dust.
speaker: Narrator

text: The foot shall tread it down, even the feet of the poor and the steps of the needy.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The way of the just is uprightness; Thou, Most Upright, dost weigh the path of the just.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, in the way of Thy judgments, O Lord, have we waited for Thee; the desire of our soul is to Thy name and to the remembrance of Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: With my soul have I desired Thee in the night; yea, with my spirit within me will I seek Thee early; for when Thy judgments are in the earth, the inhabitants of the world will learn righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let favor be shown to the wicked, yet will he not learn righteousness; in the land of uprightness will he deal unjustly, and will not behold the majesty of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, when Thy hand is lifted up, they will not see; but they shall see and be ashamed for their envy at the people; yea, the fire of Thine enemies shall devour them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, Thou wilt ordain peace for us; for Thou also hast wrought all our works in us.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord our God, other lords besides Thee have had dominion over us; but by Thee only will we make mention of Thy name.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are dead, they shall not live; they are deceased, they shall not rise; therefore hast Thou visited and destroyed them, and made all their memory to perish.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast increased the nation, O Lord, Thou hast increased the nation. Thou art glorified; Thou hadst removed it far unto all the ends of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, in trouble have they visited Thee, they poured out a prayer when Thy chastening was upon them.
speaker: Narrator

text: As a woman with child, that draweth near the time of her delivery, is in pain and crieth out in her pangs, so have we been in Thy sight, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: We have been with child, we have been in pain; we have, as it were, brought forth wind; we have not wrought any deliverance in the earth, neither have the inhabitants of the world fallen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy dead men shall live; together with my dead body shall they arise. Awake and sing, ye that dwell in dust; for thy dew is as the dew of herbs, and the earth shall cast out the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: Come, my people, enter thou into thy chambers, and shut thy doors about thee; hide thyself as it were for a little moment, until the indignation be past.
speaker: Narrator

text: For, behold, the Lord cometh out of His place to punish the inhabitants of the earth for their iniquity; the earth also shall disclose her blood, and shall no more cover her slain.
speaker: Narrator

text: In that day the Lord with His sore and great and strong sword shall punish Leviathan the piercing serpent, even Leviathan that crooked serpent; and He shall slay the dragon that is in the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: In that day sing ye unto her, “A vineyard of red wine!
speaker: Narrator

text: I, the Lord, do keep it; I will water it every moment. Lest any hurt it, I will keep it night and day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fury is not in Me. Who would set the briers and thorns against Me in battle? I would go through them; I would burn them together.
speaker: Narrator

text: Or let him take hold of My strength, that he may make peace with Me; and he shall make peace with Me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall cause them that come of Jacob to take root; Israel shall blossom and bud, and fill the face of the world with fruit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hath He smitten him, as He smote those that smote him? Or is he slain according to the slaughter of them that are slain by him?
speaker: Narrator

text: In measure, when it shooteth forth, Thou wilt debate with it; He stayeth His rough wind in the day of the east wind.
speaker: Narrator

text: By this therefore shall the iniquity of Jacob be purged; and this is all the fruit to take away his sin: When he maketh all the stones of the altar as chalkstones that are beaten asunder, the Asherah poles and sun images shall not stand up.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet the fortified city shall be desolate, and the habitation forsaken and left like a wilderness; there shall the calf feed, and there shall he lie down and consume the branches thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the boughs thereof are withered, they shall be broken off; the women come and set them on fire, for it is a people of no understanding. Therefore He that made them will not have mercy on them, and He that formed them will show them no favor.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come to pass in that day that the Lord shall beat off from the channel of the river unto the stream of Egypt, and ye shall be gathered one by one, O ye children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come to pass in that day that the great trumpet shall be blown; and they shall come who were ready to perish in the land of Assyria, and the outcasts in the land of Egypt, and shall worship the Lord in the holy mount at Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe to the crown of pride, to the drunkards of Ephraim, whose glorious beauty is a fading flower, which is on the head of the fat valleys of them that are overcome with wine!
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, the Lord hath a mighty and strong one, which as a tempest of hail and a destroying storm, as a flood of mighty waters overflowing, shall cast down to the earth with the hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: The crown of pride, the drunkards of Ephraim, shall be trodden under feet;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the glorious beauty, which is on the head of the fat valley, shall be a fading flower and as the early fruit before the summer, which when he that looketh upon it seeth; while it is yet in his hand he eateth it up.
speaker: Narrator

text: In that day shall the Lord of hosts be for a crown of glory, and for a diadem of beauty unto the residue of His people,
speaker: Narrator

text: and for a spirit of judgment to him that sitteth in judgment, and for strength to them that turn the battle to the gate.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they also have erred through wine, and through strong drink are out of the way. The priest and the prophet have erred through strong drink; they are swallowed up by wine, they are out of the way through strong drink; they err in vision, they stumble in judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all tables are full of vomit and filthiness, so that there is no place clean.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Whom shall he teach knowledge? And whom shall he make to understand doctrine? Them that are weaned from the milk and drawn from the breasts.
speaker: Narrator

text: For precept must be upon precept, precept upon precept, line upon line, line upon line, here a little and there a little.”
speaker: Narrator

text: For with stammering lips and another tongue will He speak to this people,
speaker: Narrator

text: to whom He said, “This is the rest wherewith ye may cause the weary to rest,” and, “This is the refreshing” — yet they would not hear.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the word of the Lord was unto them precept upon precept, precept upon precept, line upon line, line upon line, here a little and there a little, that they might go, and fall backward, and be broken and snared and taken.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore hear the word of the Lord, ye scornful men, that rule this people which is in Jerusalem,
speaker: Narrator

text: because ye have said, “We have made a covenant with death, and with hell are we in agreement. When the overflowing scourge shall pass through, it shall not come unto us; for we have made lies our refuge, and under falsehood have we hid ourselves.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus the servants of King Hezekiah came to Isaiah.

text: In those days was Hezekiah sick unto death. And Isaiah the prophet, the son of Amoz, came unto him and said unto him, “Thus saith the Lord: ‘Set thine house in order, for thou shalt die and not live.’”

text: Then came the word of the Lord to Isaiah, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Go, and say to Hezekiah, ‘Thus saith the Lord, the God of David thy father: I have heard thy prayer, I have seen thy tears. Behold, I will add unto thy days fifteen years.

text: The writing of Hezekiah king of Judah when he had been sick and had recovered from his sickness:

text: I said, “In the cutting off of my days I shall go to the gates of the grave; I am deprived of the residue of my years.”
